00020 #include "util/ChpCheck.h"
00021 #include "util/PgOptions.h"
00022 #include "util/RegressionCheck.h"
00023 #include "util/Util.h"
00024 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00025 //
00026 #include <cstdlib>
00027 #include <cstring>
00028 #include <iostream>
00029 #include <string>
00030 //
00031 
00032 using namespace std;
00033 const int passed = 0;
00034 const int failed = 1;
00035 
00036 
00037 int main(int argc, char* argv[])
00038 {
00039   try {
00040 
00041     //If no arguments given
00042     if(argc == 0) 
00043       {
00044         cout<<"Error: Incorrect number of arguments passed to Chp Check"<<endl;
00045         return failed;
00046       } 
00047     else 
00048       {
00049 
00050         PgOptions* opts = new PgOptions();
00051       
00052         //Set Usage message for Chp Check
00053         opts->setUsage("\n\n*****apt-check-chp Help*****");
00054       
00055         //Define acceptable Command Line arguments for apt-check-chp
00056         opts->defineOption("h", "help", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00057                            "A bool value, answer true if you want help!",
00058                            "false");
00059         opts->defineOption("g", "gold", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00060                            "A String representing theGold file to check against - the perfect/reference file",
00061                            "");
00062         opts->defineOption("n", "gen", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00063                            "A String representing the Generated File to check - the test file",
00064                            "");
00065         opts->defineOption("e", "epsilon", PgOpt::DOUBLE_OPT,
00066                            "A double that is the maximum accetable difference calculated",
00067                            "0.0001");
00068         opts->defineOption("p", "prefix", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00069                            "A string representing hte prefix for the header string alg part",
00070                            "apt-");
00071         opts->defineOption("d", "diffAllowed", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00072                            "An integer representing the number of acceptable mismatches/errors before the check fails",
00073                            "0");
00074         opts->defineOption("b", "bCheckHeaders", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00075                            "",
00076                            "true");
00077         opts->defineOption("v", "expectedRetVal", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00078                            "An integer value representing the desired return value used to flag a positive or negative test.  0 is positive, 1 is negative",
00079                            "0");
00080         opts->defineOption("t", "testName", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00081                            "testName = Name of the Test being Run",
00082                            "");
00083         //Parse argv and store it within PgOptions class variables
00084         //Match the command line arguments to the proper options
00085         opts->parseArgv(argv);
00086 
00087         if(opts->getBool("help") == true)
00088           {
00089             opts->usage();
00090             return passed;
00091           }
00092 
00093         std::string gen;
00094         std::string gold;
00095         if(opts->get("gen") != "")
00096           {
00097             gen = opts->get("gen");
00098           }
00099         else
00100           {
00101             cout<<"Error: No value for Generated Files (gen) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00102             return failed;
00103           }
00104 
00105         if(opts->get("gold") != "")
00106           {
00107             gold = opts->get("gold");
00108           }
00109         else
00110           {
00111             cout<<"Error: No value for Gold Files (gold) given.  Exiting"<<endl;
00112             return failed;
00113           }
00114       
00115         //Store variable values
00116         double eps = opts->getDouble("epsilon");
00117         int diffAllowed = opts->getInt("diffAllowed");
00118         std::string prefix = opts->get("prefix");
00119         bool bCheckHeaders = opts->getBool("bCheckHeaders");
00120         int expectedRetVal = opts->getInt("expectedRetVal");
00121         std::string testName = opts->get("testName");
00122 
00123         //Run Check
00124         ChpCheck* cCheck;
00125         cCheck = new ChpCheck(gen, gold, diffAllowed, prefix, eps, bCheckHeaders);
00126         string errorMsg = "";
00127         bool pass =  cCheck->check(errorMsg);
00128 
00129         //Test for Regular Pass (Positive)
00130         if(expectedRetVal == 0)
00131           {
00132             if(!pass)
00133               {
00134                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00135                 cout<<"Error: Failed Chp Check"<<endl;
00136                 return failed;
00137               }
00138             else
00139               {
00140                 cout<<"Passed Chp Check"<<endl;
00141                 return passed;
00142               } 
00143           }
00144         //Test for Negative
00145         else
00146           {
00147             if(pass)
00148               {
00149                 cout<<"Error in " + testName + "(): " + errorMsg<<endl;
00150                 cout<<"Error: Failed Chp Check"<<endl;
00151                 return failed;
00152               }
00153             else
00154               {
00155                 cout<<"Passed Chp Check"<<endl;
00156                 return passed;
00157               } 
00158           }
00159 
00160       }
00161   } 
00162   catch(...) 
00163     {
00164       Verbose::out(1,"Unexpected Error: uncaught exception.");
00165       return failed;
00166     }
00167   return failed;
00168 }
